en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] ca. 1824 Oct. 20

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt, dated Monday October 20, around the year 1824, announces the adjournment of the court until the next day due to the absence of a judge. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] ca. 1824 Oct. 20 : page 1

body.value: Monday 20 Court convened agreeable to adjourment adjournment Present J. Daniel Richard Walker , J Martin being absent, Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
